snippet: China is increasingly making its presence felt in the South China Sea, with larger navy patrols and a newly strengthened army garrison on a tiny island.
abstract: China is increasingly making its presence felt in the South China Sea, with larger navy patrols and a newly strengthened army garrison on a tiny island; leadership in Beijing appears to have fastened on to the South China Sea as a way of showing its domestic audience that China is now a regional power, able to get its way in an area it has long considered rightfully its own; some analysts view the stepped-up actions as a diversion from the once-a-decade leadership transition.
lead_paragraph: China is increasingly making its presence felt in the South China Sea, with larger navy patrols and a newly strengthened army garrison on a tiny island.

headline.seo: Beijing Reasserts Its Claims in South China Sea
headline.main: China Asserts Sea Claim With Politics and Ships
headline.print_headline: China Asserts Sea Claim With Politics and Ships
